member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.SlotCannotHaveEmptyModuleSetException
member.summary: An exception that is thrown when the WFC tries to remove the last remaining module from a slot's possibility space. A slot cannot have zero possibilities.

member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.SlotCannotSelectUnavailableModule
member.summary: An exception that is thrown if a slot tries to select a module that is no longer possible, due to constraints.

member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.ModuleSet
member.summary: A ModuleSet is a collection of modules. It is a HashSet, with a few helpful methods attached to it.

member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.WFCProgress
member.summary: The class represents a unit of progress in the WFC algorithm. As the algorithm is run, a sequence of WCFProgress items will be returned. Different types of progress will be returned, and you can switch on the type to gain insights to the algorithm's decisions...

member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.WFCError
member.summary: A WFCError instance could be returned by the WFC algorithm. If you receive one of these instances, it means something with the process has broken.

member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.SlotModuleRemoved
member.summary: A progress instance that explains what module was removed from a slot's possibility space.

member.name: F:BrewedInk.WFC.SlotModuleRemoved.slot
member.summary: The slot that has had a module removed.

member.name: F:BrewedInk.WFC.SlotModuleRemoved.module
member.summary: The module that is no longer available for the slot

member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.SlotModuleSelected
member.summary: A progress instance that explains what module was selected for a slot. When this progress type shows up, it means the superposition for the given slot has collapsed to the given module.

member.name: F:BrewedInk.WFC.SlotModuleSelected.slot
member.summary: The slot whose superposition has collapsed.

member.name: F:BrewedInk.WFC.SlotModuleSelected.module
member.summary: The module that has been selected for the given slot

member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.WFCProgressObserver
member.summary: A wrapper class around the invocation of a WFC collapse operation. You should use this in conjunction with

member.name: P:BrewedInk.WFC.WFCProgressObserver.ProgressCount
member.summary: The number of progress events received for this operation. There isn't a knowable upper bound, but you can use this to track that progress is happening.

member.name: P:BrewedInk.WFC.WFCProgressObserver.IsComplete
member.summary: Returns true when the operation is complete. This will be true the instant BEFORE the onComplete callbacks are invoked.

member.name: P:BrewedInk.WFC.WFCProgressObserver.SlotSelections
member.summary: A set of selections you can use inspect to see what has finished. If you want an event driven approach, use

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.WFCProgressObserver.OnProgress(System.Action{BrewedInk.WFC.WFCProgress})
member.summary: A callback that executes anytime the WFC has new progress. Progress elements can represent a module being removed, or a module being selected, an error, or a general propagation of data.
member.param: A callback to run on progress
member.returns: The same WFCProgressObserver

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.WFCProgressObserver.OnCompleted(System.Action)
member.summary: A callback that executes when the WFC operation has completed. This happens right after the is set to true.
member.param: a callback to run on completion
member.returns: The same WFCProgressObserver

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.WFCProgressObserver.OnSelectedModule(System.Action{BrewedInk.WFC.SlotModuleSelected})
member.summary: A callback that executes anytime a slot collapses to a single module possibility. This is a type of , and will execute right after the callbacks
member.param: A callback that takes a general selection. The module isn't typed, so you'll need to type-check it.
member.returns: The same WFCProgressObserver

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.WFCProgressObserver.OnSelectedModule(System.Action{BrewedInk.WFC.Slot,BrewedInk.WFC.Module})
member.summary: A callback that executes anytime a slot collapses to a single module possibility. This is a type of , and will execute right after the callbacks
member.param: A callback that takes a slot and a general selection. The module isn't typed, so you'll need to type-check it.
member.returns: The same WFCProgressObserver

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.WFCProgressObserver.OnSelectedModule``1(System.Action{BrewedInk.WFC.Slot,``0})
member.summary: A callback that executes anytime a slot collapses to a single module possibility. This is a type of , and will execute right after the callbacks
member.param: A callback that takes a slot and typed module. This callback only fires when a module of the given type is selected
member.typeparam: the type of module this callback applies for.
member.returns: The same WFCProgressObserver

member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.WFCProgressExtensions
member.summary: A Utility class for IEnumerable sets of

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.WFCProgressExtensions.RunAsCoroutine(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{BrewedInk.WFC.WFCProgress},UnityEngine.MonoBehaviour,System.Single)
member.summary: A method to run any WFC operation within a Unity Coroutine with frame time budgeting. This method will process as many elements in the WFC operation as possible in on frame, then yield a render frame, and continue the operation on the next frame. This is the recommended way to run WFC operations in a realtime game. This returns a object which you can attach progress callbacks and inspect the running state.
member.param: Any WFC operation. This could be the return value from any Collapse related function in the
Some Monobehaviour to run the Coroutine in.
How much is available per frame to operate on the WFC sequence? This should be a low number, so that it doesn't cause hitches in your game.
member.returns: a WFCProgressObserver

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.WFCProgressExtensions.RunAsImmediate(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{BrewedInk.WFC.WFCProgress},System.Action{BrewedInk.WFC.WFCProgress})
member.summary: Completely iterate through a WFC operation in one frame. Using this method will likely cause lag in your game, and it is only recommended for testing or advanced use.
member.param: Any WFC operation. This could be the return value from any Collapse related function in the
An optional callback that runs every time a WFCProgress element is processed.

member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.GenerationSpace
member.summary: The Generation Space is the main access point for the WFC algorithm. The Generation Space holds a directed graph of Slots, and a set of all possible modules per slot. The Generation Space has methods for collapsing the superposition of the Slots, until all slots only have one module option left.

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.GenerationSpace.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{BrewedInk.WFC.Slot},System.Collections.Generic.List{BrewedInk.WFC.SlotEdge},BrewedInk.WFC.ModuleSet,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Create a new instance of the WFC algorithm. Each time you construct an instance of the Generation Space, you are setting up a new superposition with nothing collapsed. You can also use utility methods to create a new Generation space.
member.param: A set of slots to perform the WFC on. Every slot will be assumed to have every module as a possibility
A set of edges that connect the slots.
A set of all the modules, with the constraints already provided
An optional random seed. If you provide the same seed, the WFC algorithm will produce the same output given the same inputs.

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.GenerationSpace.GetSlot(UnityEngine.Vector3Int)
member.summary: Find a slot given a position. If no slot exists at the given position, this method will return null.
member.returns: The slot at the given position, or null if none exists

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.GenerationSpace.GetSlotOptions(BrewedInk.WFC.Slot)
member.summary: At any given moment, a slot may have many possible modules available to it. This method will give you the set of possible modules available on a slot.
member.param: The slot whose available modules will be returned
member.returns: A set of modules representing all possible modules for the given slot

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.GenerationSpace.TryGetOnlyOption(BrewedInk.WFC.Slot,BrewedInk.WFC.Module@)
member.summary:
At any given moment, a slot may have many possible modules available to it. However, eventually, a slot will only have one possible module remaining. This method will help you identify when there is only one module left per slot. If there is only one module left for the given slot, this method will return true and store the assigned module in the out parameter. If there is more than one module possible, the method will return false, and the out variable will be null.
You can also retrieve all of the available slot modules with the GenerationSpace.GetSlotOptions method.
member.param: The slot whose only remaining available module will be checked.

An out variable for the only remaining available module. After the method is invoked, the value of the module will be the last module for the slot, or null if there are more than one modules remaining.
member.returns: true if there was only one module available, or false otherwise.

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.GenerationSpace.CollapseSlot(BrewedInk.WFC.Slot)
member.summary: Given a slot with many module possibilities, collapse the possibility space so that only one module is possible for the given slot. This will cause many propagation events, and may cause other slots to collapse to a single module possibility as well. If the given slot has many module possibilities, one module will be selected at random.
member.param: The slot to collapse to a single module possibility
member.returns: A sequence of representing the completion of the collapse operation. The resulting sequence must be enumerated, or the collapse won't complete.

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.GenerationSpace.CollapseLowestEntropySlot
member.summary:
Collapse the superposition of some slot. The slot that is selected is the slot in the Generation Space with the lowest entropy. A Slot's entropy is found by taking the count of available modules remaining at the slot. This will cause many propagation events, and may cause other slots to collapse to a single module possibility as well. By default, WFC always prefer to collapse the slot with the lowest entropy, because it is less likely to produce an invalid outcome.
If there are multiple slots with the same entropy, the first one detected in the Generation Space's internal data structure will be used. It is not random. It depends on how the slots were created in the constructor of the Generation Space.

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.GenerationSpace.GetEntropy(BrewedInk.WFC.Slot)
member.summary: Calculates the current entropy of a slot. Entropy is roughly equal to the number of modules left in the slot's wave function. The contribution of each module is weighted by the module's weight. The exact entropy calculation is -sum( p log(p) ) over all modules where each p is the probability of the module.
member.param: The slot to find the entropy of
member.returns: The current entropy of the slot

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.GenerationSpace.GetEntropy(BrewedInk.WFC.ModuleSet)
member.summary: Calculates the entropy of a set of modules. Entropy is -sum(p log(p) ) over all modules where each p is the probability of the module
member.param: A set of modules
member.returns: The entropy of the given set of modules

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.GenerationSpace.Reset
member.summary: Reset all slot superpositions so that all modules are likely again.

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.GenerationSpace.Validate
member.summary: Evaluate all constraints in the Generation Space and return the number if invalid constraints. Ideally, this method should always return zero. However, you can use this to check that the constraints are indeed valid if you suspect that the collapse has errored.
member.returns: The number of broken constraints in the Generation Space.

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.GenerationSpace.Collapse
member.summary:
Run the WFC algorithm to completion on the Generation Space. This method will keep on collapsing the slot with the lowest entropy until all slots have been collapsed to a single module possibility.
This method may take a long time to complete if the Generation Space is large. You should interweave the resulting progress set with a Coroutine with render frames.
member.returns: A sequence of representing the completion of the collapse operation. The entire sequence must be enumerated or the collapse won't finish.

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.GenerationSpace.CollapseSlot(BrewedInk.WFC.Slot,BrewedInk.WFC.Module)
member.summary: Collapse a slot to a given module outcome. If a slot had N possible modules, after this method runs, the slot would only have 1 possible module. This will cause many propagation events, and may cause other slots to collapse to a single module possibility as well.
member.param: A slot to collapse to one module possibility
the module that will be only remaining possibility for the given slot
member.returns: A sequence of representing the progress of the collapse operation. The sequence must be enumerated, or the collapse won't finish.
member.exception: You cannot select a module for a slot if the slot doesn't already contain the module in its superposition.

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.GenerationSpace.RemoveSlotOption(BrewedInk.WFC.Slot,BrewedInk.WFC.Module)
member.summary: A small way to collapse the wave function. At some given slot, this method removes some given module from the set of possible modules at the slot. Before this method is run, the given slot may have N possible modules. After the method is run, that slot will have N-1 possible modules. This method collapses the superposition at the given slot, which also means that neighboring slots may need to remove modules given the new position. This method triggers a propagation event in the Generation Space. As such, it returns a consumable sequence of WFCProgress elements. The faster you consume the sequence, the faster the entire propagation phase happens. You may wish to sow render frames between calls. The sequence must be iterated through, or the propagation won't finish.
member.param: A slot to remove a module option from
The module to be removed from the slot
member.returns: A sequence of representing the progress of the propagation event. The sequence must be iterated through, or the propagation won't occur.
member.exception: An exception will be thrown if removing a module from a slot would cause the slot to have zero possible modules. A slot must always have at least one possibility.

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.GenerationSpace.GetEdges(BrewedInk.WFC.Slot)
member.summary: Get a Slot's edges.
member.param: The slot to get the edges for.
member.returns: A list of edges for the given slot

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.GenerationSpace.From2DGrid(System.Int32,System.Int32,BrewedInk.WFC.ModuleSet,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Action{System.Collections.Generic.List{BrewedInk.WFC.Slot},System.Collections.Generic.List{BrewedInk.WFC.SlotEdge}})
member.summary: A utility method for building a Generation Space in the form of a 2D grid. All Generation Spaces are directed graphs, and the resulting Generation Space from this method will be a graph representing a 2D grid. Each cell in the grid will have neighbors to the west, east, south, and north. There are no diagonal neighbors.
member.param: The width of the resulting 2D grid Generation Space
The height of the resulting 2D grid Generation Space
The set of all possible modules, with constraints prepopulated. Every Slot that is created in this Generation Space will have all modules available at the start of the WFC.
An optional seed that controls how the WFC decides random operations.

An optional callback to control how edges are created in the 2D grid. If this parameter is left null, every slot will have edges to the west, east, south, and north. If you need to change how the edges are created, remove certain edges, or add additional edges, you can provide your own implementation of this callback. If you provide a callback value, you are responsible for populating the entire List of SlotEdges per given Slot.
member.returns: A Generation Space representing a 2D grid of slots where every slot has every module available to it at the start of the WFC.

member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.Module
member.summary: In the WFC algorithm, a module is a possibility for some

member.name: F:BrewedInk.WFC.Module.Display
member.summary: Every module must have a unique display name. This name is used for hashing and equality checks.

member.name: F:BrewedInk.WFC.Module.Weight
member.summary: A module's weight controls how likely it is to be chosen randomly during a slot collapse. A module with a with a weight of zero will be never be randomly picked.

member.name: F:BrewedInk.WFC.Module.Constraints
member.summary: Every module has a set of . At the start of the WFC algorithm, every module is possible in all slots. The constraints for the module in each slot are all still plausible. As the Wave Function collapses, module possibilities are removed, and various constraints become impossible to fulfill. When that happens, this module becomes invalid itself.

member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.Slot
member.summary: In the WFC algorithm, a Slot is a place that holds one . As the Wave Function is being collapsed, the slot may have many potential modules available to it. As the collapse continues, modules are removed as possibilities from the slot, until there is only one module possible for the slot.

member.name: F:BrewedInk.WFC.Slot.Coordinate
member.summary: The slot's position in the larger generation space.

member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.AdjacencyConstraint
member.summary: A WFC constraint that enforces neighboring modules per slot. For example, This constraint lets a module express that its western neighbor must be of a certain module.

member.name: F:BrewedInk.WFC.AdjacencyConstraint.Delta
member.summary: The positional difference this constraint applies for. If the module is being tested between two slots (A, and B), the constraint only applies if the positional difference between A and B equals the Delta.

member.name: F:BrewedInk.WFC.AdjacencyConstraint.NeedsOneOf
member.summary: A set of possible module values that can exist at a slot with the given Delta.

member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.ModuleConstraint
member.summary: The base type for all WFC constraints. Feel free to subclass this type and make your own constraints.

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.ModuleConstraint.ShouldRemoveModule(BrewedInk.WFC.SlotEdge,BrewedInk.WFC.GenerationSpace,BrewedInk.WFC.Module,BrewedInk.WFC.ModuleSet)
member.summary:
The only required method of a WFC constraint. Given some edge and some module-in-question, should the module-in-question be removed from the edge's source's possibility space?
When the WFC algorithm propagates information, every possible module per slot is checked against every neighboring slot. If ANY neighboring slot has a constraint that disqualifies the module-in-question, the module will be removed from the source's superposition. This in turn, causes a new propagation wave.
member.param: The edge whose source slot's superposition is being checked. If the method returns true, the given module will be removed from the edge's source's slot's superposition.
The generation space that this edge and module are apart of. The space is made available so that checks can be made for other available modules at the edge source and destination slots.
The module-in-question. Should this module be removed from the edge source, because of the edge destination?
An advanced capability. Anything in this set will be removed from the edge source's superposition. You can manually add to the set, but only if you are extremely confident.
member.returns: Return true if the module should be removed from the edge's source's super position, because the constraint is invalid. Return false if the module doesn't break the constraint.

member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.SlotEdge
member.summary: A SlotEdge is the connection between two slots. In a simple 2D 1X2 grid case, there are two slots, and one slot edge connecting them. The term "edge" comes from Graph Theory. These edges are directional.

member.name: F:BrewedInk.WFC.SlotEdge.Source
member.summary: The origin slot of the edge.

member.name: F:BrewedInk.WFC.SlotEdge.Target
member.summary: The destination slot of the edge.

member.name: F:BrewedInk.WFC.WCFConfigObject`2.useSeed
member.summary: Should the instances that this instance creates use a seed?/>

member.name: F:BrewedInk.WFC.WCFConfigObject`2.seed
member.summary: If the useSeed boolean is true, what seed should be used? This property should be ignored if useSeed is false.

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.WCFConfigObject`2.TryGetObject(BrewedInk.WFC.Module,`0@)
member.summary: Given the typeless Module, get the wrapper object for it. The wrapper object may have additional metadata about the module that isn't used in the WFC algorithm, but may be useful for other parts of the game.
member.param: The module you want to get the wrapper object for
The wrapper object for the Module. Or null if there is no wrapper object for the given Module
member.returns: True if there was an associated wrapper object with the module, or false.

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.WCFConfigObject`2.CreateSpace
member.summary: You need to create a Generation Space given a set of user defined modules and configuration.
member.returns: You should return a new GenerationSpace instance that respects the seed properties.

member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.WCFConfigObject
member.summary: A ScriptableObject wrapper that streamlines creating instances from MonoBehaviours.

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.WCFConfigObject.Create
member.summary: Create a blank from the configuration. This is a useful method for creating generation spaces pre-configured with edges, slots, and modules.
member.returns: A new Generation Space

member.name: M:BrewedInk.WFC.WCFConfigObject.TryGetSprite(BrewedInk.WFC.Module,UnityEngine.Sprite@)
member.summary: If a module has a Sprite associated with it, you can use this method to try and get it. Depending on the type of Module, there may not be any Sprite available.
member.param: The module you'd like to get a sprite for.
The Sprite associated with the given module. The sprite will be null if there is no associated Sprite for the module.
member.returns: True if there is any sprite associated with the module, false otherwise. If the method returns false, you can expect the sprite to be null.

member.name: T:BrewedInk.WFC.WFCGridRenderer

member.summary: Any configuration that contains sprites for previews.

member.name: F:BrewedInk.WFC.WFCGridRenderer.board

member.name: T:SpriteConfig
